data.title: Esporte Clube Vitória: 20 Football Club Facts
data.meta_description: Discover 20 fascinating facts about Esporte Clube Vitória, one of the most iconic football clubs in Brazil, known for its rich history, passionate fans, and impressive achievements.
data.text:
Founding and Establishment

Esporte Clube Vitória was founded on May 13, 1899, making it one of the oldest football clubs in Brazil.

Club Colors

The club’s official colors are red and black, which represent strength, passion, and determination.

Stadium

Vitória’s home stadium is the Estádio Manoel Barradas, also known as Barradão, with a capacity of approximately 35,000 spectators.

Success in Brazilian Championships

Vitória has won the Campeonato Baiano, the top-tier state championship in Bahia, a record 30 times.

National Achievements

The club has also achieved success at the national level, winning the Copa do Brasil in 2010 and reaching the final of the Brazilian Championship in 1993.

Rivalries

Vitória has fierce rivalries with Bahia and Sport Club Internacional, with matches between these teams known for their intense atmosphere.

Notable Players

Over the years, Vitória has produced many talented players, including Bebeto, Hulk, and Kieza, who have represented the club with distinction.

Youth Development

Vitória places a strong emphasis on youth development and has a renowned youth academy that has produced several future stars.

International Competitions

Vitória has participated in various international competitions, including the Copa Sudamericana and the Copa Libertadores.

Record Transfer

The club’s record transfer took place in 1995 when Edílson was sold to the Dutch club Feyenoord for a substantial fee.

Supporters

Vitória boasts a passionate fan base known as “Rubro-Negros” who show unwavering support for their team.

Community Involvement

The club is actively involved in community initiatives and social projects aimed at promoting football and improving the lives of local residents.

Historic Matches

Vitória’s history is filled with memorable matches, including their victory over Santos in the final of the 1967 Torneio Roberto Gomes Pedrosa.

Club Anthem

The club has a distinctive anthem called “Vitória Minha Vida”, which is sung by the fans during matches and represents the club’s identity.

Legends of the Game

Vitória has had its fair share of legendary players, including Dida, Vampeta, and Túlio Maravilha, who have left lasting impressions on the club and its supporters.

Women’s Football Team

Vitória also has a women’s football team that competes in various tournaments, showcasing the club’s commitment to gender equality in sports.

Community Support

Vitória plays an active role in its community, supporting charitable organizations and initiatives that aim to improve the lives of those in need.

Record Attendances

The Estádio Manoel Barradas has witnessed several record attendances, with passionate fans filling the stadium to cheer on their beloved Vitória.

Sponsorship

Vitória has had various sponsorship deals over the years, with companies supporting the club’s endeavors both on and off the field.

Looking Towards the Future

With a strong foundation, passionate supporters, and a commitment to success, Esporte Clube Vitória looks forward to a bright future as it continues to make its mark in Brazilian football.
